page.title: 09Landscape in Llangybi
page.content: Mainly gentle hills divided by hedges into fields for pasture and country lanes with hedges on either side.The hedges in many cases contain mature trees.There are a few deciduous coppices and a small,mainly coniferous wood.From the hills on the west side of the village there are extensive views towards the Wentwood Hills.The dual carriageway from Newport to Monmouth can be seen in the Usk River Valley,also the parish churches of Llangybi and Llantrisant.There are water meadows streching almost from the road through the village of Llangybi to the River Usk.In every direction there are farmhouses dotted about.Most of these have large modern barn structures in their yards and a few have silo towers.
